chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:33 AM Defendant Thomas A Kronquist Jr in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Thomas A Kronquist Jr.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reporter appeared by zoom.
Attorney Rockow requests trial date.  JT 11/7/22 - Proposed Jury Instructions, Witness Lists, Verdict Forms, any Motions and Notice of Intent to Use Video are to be filed no later than 10/24/22.  Bond continued.  Address and phone number confirmed.

Formal reading of Information waived.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Plea date set.  Address and phone number confirmed.
Plea hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Defendant must have no contact with with C.D.

1:16 PM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas A Kronquist Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow (for today only) appeared by video for Thomas A Kronquist Jr. 

AIA set; may appear by zoom video.
Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney. 


(Bond and MS scanned to jail)
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
